title: What if Killing is a Feature not a Bug?
description:
What if the killing is a feature and not a bug of our fallen human nature? What if the Romanticism of our goodness is just an attempt to justify the pervasive violence of human history? The movie Ad Astra is the standard mythos of American religion. The movie Joker deconstructs it. If this is true of us, do we have hope for a future? Has the hope offered by the movie laden American religion always simply been a denial of death?
